newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Euro-MPs approve regulations on single currency.
newsitem.headline: Euro-MPs approve regulations on single currency.

text.p: The European Parliament on Thursday approved a draft regulation which brings in increased monitoring of EU member states' budgets and coordination of their economic policies in the run-up to the single currency.

Giving a second reading to the ECOFIN Council's common position on proposal COM(96)496 (co-decision procedure), Euro-MPs said they were not opposed to the ministers' demands for countries not participating in the third stage of economic and monetary union to submit convergence programmes.
But they said the Council needed to set more realistic convergence criteria for the "outs" and give them extra support to cope with the pressure that the foreign exchange markets will exert on them.

Parliament said the concept of government investment expenditure should be included as a criteria for judging expected economic performance, along with gross domestic product, employment and inflation.

Euro-MPs approved a second regulation -- COM(97)117, consulation procedure -- designed to speed up and clarify the procedure for imposing penalties on countries which register excessive budget deficits.
They introduced an amendment which stipulates that any fines or interest on deposits should be put into the EU budget, not national coffers.
